Open Manifest]

HDG.IWM.content: “understanding”: relation that tries to enter into relation of truth of Being to human essence, ecstatic, thrown projection, standing in realm of the open > realm that opens for us in projection is called meaning > “Meaning of Being” says same as “truth of Being” [not identical?]

HDG.FS.content: Greeks lived immediately in openness of phenomena—through expressly ek-static capacity of letting phenomena speak to them (modern man, via Descartes, only talks to himself, human as representer), no Greek word for being of human in alētheia, not due to lack, but due to excess > belonging to alētheia as Greek destiny: moira

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger speaks of something inappropriate in formulation of “meaning of being,” possible to interpret “project” as a human performance, project only as structure of subjectivity (this is how Sartre reads it) > Heidegger countered this mistake w/ “truth of being,” still retaining meaning of project as opening disclosure (Erschliessung), and to assure that truth wasn’t confused w/ correctness, Heidegger explained it by “location (Ortschaft) of being,” which presupposes understanding of Ortseins des Ortes (place-being of place), hence Topologie des Seyns

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger calls analysis of temporality of Dasein a non-metaphysical thinking of time > time no longer series of now moments, but horizon for understanding of being > analytic of Dasein provides equipment making possible sense of being in non-metaphysical signification: destruction achieves its goal (ihr Ziel gebracht) [?????]—but, various coverings of originary sense of being maintain essential relation to what they cover over, so that metaphysics can be read positively, transformations of original meaning all belonging to single destiny—Seinsgeschick

HDG.FS.content: negative (Nichten) vs. denying (Verneinen): Greek distinction ouk and mē? > negating as Greek ouk, then nothing as total nothingness (nihil negativum): beings denied, there are no beings > negating via mē, certain defect re: being > but if being/nothing are same, nothing can’t signify a lack (Fehlen), negating not privative-negative, something other (etwas Anderes), completely specific/unique (ganz und gar Eigenes und Unvergleichliches)

HDG.FS.content: nothing characterizes being: ontological proposition > when nothing & its negating aren’t understood negatively, being is something entirely other (etwas ganz und gar Anders) than a being > participle “nihilating (nichtend)” as determinate activity of being, durch die allein das Seiende ist > name it an origin if all ontic-causal overtones are excluded [possible?]: Ereignis of Being as condition for arrival (Ankunft) of beings: das Sein lasst das Seinde anwesen [factical life]

HDG.FS.content: human belongs to openness of Being > Being, for its opening, needs man as the there of its manifestation [Larry’s emphasis] > Ge-stell helps us see that human is “used by being (vom Sein gebraucht),” also the shepherd of being, berger (French is better here), one who provides shelter > that Being needs something of human to be: finitude of being must be assumed (not absolutely for itself, pointed contradiction to Hegel)

HDG.DL.content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

HDG.DL.content: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

HDG.DL.content: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

HDG.DL.content: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

HDG.LP.content: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

HDG.LP.content: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

HDG.LP.content: Trakl silently sounds the mystery (Geheimnis) > the unity (Einheit) of “One Generation (Ein Geschlecht),” arises (entquillt) from the race (Schlag) that gathers along path of stranger, enfolds discord of generations into gentler two-fold > One of One Generation, not opposed to two but hidden unifying force [indifference point?] > Geschlecht names historical generation of man, mankind as distinct (Unterschied) from all other living creatures, names race, tribes, clans, families, & always refers to twofoldness of sexes

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger will call the unity of language: Aufriss (design rift), name demands we see proper of language’s essence more clearly > [English translator offers etymology of “sign” in design, Latin signum, secare, to cut] riss like ritzen (carve), to cut a furrow in soil, open to seed/growth > Auf-riss the whole of the traits (Züge) that structures & prevails throughout (durchfügt) the open/freedom of language > Aufriss the drawing/outline (Zeichnung) of language, structure (Gefüge) of a show/indication (Zeigens) in which speakers/speaking, spoken/unspoken, are joined (verfugt)

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?

HDG.WL.content: showing prevails in Saying, even in everything that waits for us unspoken > Saying not linguistic expression added to phenomenon: all radiant appearance/fading away grounded (beruht) in showing Saying > Saying pervades (durchwaltet)/structures (fügt) openness of clearing (das Freie der Lichtung) that every appearance must seek & every disappearance must leave behind, in which all present/absent being must show/say/announce itself > Saying: the gathering that joins all appearance (alles Scheinen fügende Versammlung), lets all that shows abide w/in itself, the in-itself manifold showing

HDG.WL.content: [method of arrival, in the instant?] we need a plain, sudden, unforgettable thus forever new look (Blick) into something we don’t even try to know > the quick and stirring regsames Erregende) of Saying: earliest/most ancient at once, region of all places, first break of dawn for all that is present/absent, that which makes the cycle of day/night possible: Das Regende im Zeigen der Sage ist das Eignen ——Eignen (Owning) that moves Saying as Showing is Ereignis, yields (er-gibt) opening of the clearing, in which present beings can persist (anwähren) & absent beings can depart, while keeping (behalten) their persistence (Währen) in withdrawal (im Entzug) [cf. erasure of trace] > das Ereignende [what is yielding] ist das Ereignis selbst—nothing else > Ereignis can’t be represented as occurrence (Vorkommnis) or happening (Geschehen), “can only be experienced as abiding gift yielded (Gewährende) by saying” > Ereignis is not the result of something, but the giving yield (Er-gebnis), whose giving along gives us Es gibt, to which even Being needs to come [so to come] into its own as presence (um als Anwesen in sein Eigenes zu gelangen)

HDG.WL.content: along the way, what looks like a tangle untangles [arrival?], release/light of way-making movement > movement brings Saying to speech, Saying keeps way open > die Be-wëgung der Sage zur Sprache ist das entbindende Band, das verbindet, indem es er-eignet [bond that binds by appropriating] > language delivered (entbunden) to its own freedom: concerned solely w/ itself > but language as Saying not only self-seeking, the appropriating showing disregards precisely itself, to free what is shown to its proper appearance [withdrawal of language, Saying, Ereignis]

HDG.TC.content: deliberately speaking of annihilation (Vernichtung), not just destruction (Zerstörung): annihilation is the more encompassing (umfassendere) destruction (also takes into account destruction of countless lives) > can only speak of annihilation by intimations (Andeutungen), point away from what is not meant > annihilation not the highest grade of destruction but essentially other (wesenhaft anderes) than destruction > always something left over w/ destruction, no “remainderless (restlose)” destruction > there is no annihilation at all: the destruction where nothing left remaining, this remainder (Übrig) is nothing: has consumed (aufgezehrt) every “is” & itself > from destruction to annihilation, a change of condition, leap into another essence > not only nothing still left remaining in annihilation, but something, and only, of its own arises (entsteht)

HDG.EC.content: overcome by something healing (Heilsames) on a walk: not just the capaciousness (Geräumige) of the expanse (Weite) but the expanse itself > carried to what is objectless w/out dissolving, expanse delivers our essence to the open (Offene), gathers it into simplicity: as if the expanse’s abiding (Verweilen) were a pure arrival (reine Ankunft)—we are the entranceway (Einlass) [cf. p. 147]

HDG.EC.content: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

HDG.EC.content: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation

HDG.EC.content: those among a people (Volk) [Germans?] who poetize/think, wait in most noble manner: durch deren Gegenwart [through the present-waiting of the poet] zum Kommen das Wort in die Antwort des Menschenwesens gelangt und also in die Sprache gebracht wird > poets/thinkers wait on the arrival of this essence of theirs [devastation already passed over?], waiting people endangered like no other [rare], endangered not from outside threats but by tyranny of ignorant impatience, continual mistakes > Während dieses voreilige Scheinwesen [rash pseudo-essence] doch nur die ewig unbeholfene Nachahmung des Fremden bleibt [bad imitation of the foreign, Larry] > the people (Volk) who know its essence, can’t insist on it as a special calling (besondere Berufung)/distinction (Auszeichnung) > waiting people entirely unusable (unbrauchbar) to others, what waits yields nothing to be used (Nutzen) for progress > any fame of these people must squander its essence purely on the unnecessary

HDG.OHF.content: [phenomenology beyond dialectic] dialectic directionless (richtungslos) when no Grundblick in direction of (auf) the subject matter (Sache), a rationality testing/proving itself by looking this way (i.e. not dialectically) [Heidegger uses rationality affirmatively here?] > all dialectic lives from table of others, Hegel: “this traditional material” (Plato, Aristotle) “extremely importance source, indeed a necessary condition [and] presupposition to be gratefully acknowledged” (Science of Logic) > dialectic is double-sidedly un-radical: 1) lives from hand to mouth 2) eloquent about readymade material

HDG.OHF.content: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]

HDG.OHF.content: developing (Ausbilden) of context of classificatory order is the leading self-conditioning mode of philosophy [the other 2: 1) the Ausgangsverhalten 2) accommodating multiplicity of types], analogous to holding-in-view of style in historical consciousness > this leading mode not a mere depicting, but a creative developing (schöpferisches Ausbilden) of the order itself: fashions (bildet) for/out of itself possibility of a universal process

HDG.OHF.content: relation of definitions of classificatory order: not one and then the other, but one is defined as that which belongs to the other [hetero-tautology], in itself it is the other as well, all others: (Welche Vorhabe? die des Wegsehens!) > the as-well-as (Sowohl-als auch), fundamental formal/categorial structure, limitlessness of its universality [bad infinity?]

HDG.OHF.content: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present

HDG.OHF.content: Besorgenswege [ways of care]: the beings-which-are-there don’t stand w/in definiteness of definitions, but w/in everydayness & its historicity (Geschichtlichkeit); the there in advance (vorhandene Da) brings the appearance (Vorschein) of “others” into its Dasein > what one-self pursues, that wherein one tarries for a while, one-self (man-selbst) “is” this world: everydayness of Dasein has its Dasein there for itself, seeking it by heeding what others say about it: possibilities of familiarity (of everyday) are factically historical [Mitsein]
